subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Houston midfielder Ricardo Clark was suspended nine games by Major League Soccer — the longest suspension in league history — for violently kicking Carlos Ruiz of F.C. Dallas on Sunday. With the Dynamo winning by 3-0, Clark kicked Ruiz in the right shoulder while he was on the ground, causing a brief skirmish. Clark was ejected.
